title: Website
text:
Creat a new website project
quarto create-project your-web-site-dir --type website
Add _site/ to .gitignore if necessary.
Preview the website with
cd your-web-site-dir
quarto preview
The preview web server is slow. Consider using Node.js
npx http-server -p 3000 -o _site -a 127.0.0.1
Publish to GitHub Pages, see GitHut Pages for details.
Create gh-pages branch (only necessary the first time)
git checkout --orphan gh-pages
git reset --hard # make sure you've committed changes before running this!
git commit --allow-empty -m "Initialising gh-pages branch"
git push origin gh-pages
Check out the publishing branch (not on the gh-pages branch), and
quarto publish gh-pages
See Quarto for more details.

title: MyQuartoDoc
text: This is a Quarto website to collect commonly used features to write technical report.

Incomplete VSCode outline





Key words,

VSCode, Codium, Quarto, Markdown
outline, incomplete, error, missing, bug

When using many custom blocks (more than 15) in the same qmd file, such as
::: {.callout-note}
Note
:::
The outline functionality in VSCode may not work properly. A dirty work around is to add
:::
:::
to separate each custom blocks to reset. For example,
::: {.callout-note}
Note
:::

:::
:::

::: {.callout-note}
Note
:::
In this way, outline of all sections will show up properly. Unfortunately, ::: ::: will show up in the final documentation. The decision to add ::: ::: or not is then between the importance of easy navigation in the qmd file vs. clean reading in the final document.









Remove ::: ::: before rendering





It is possible to pre-process the qmd file to remove ::: ::: before rendering. In this way, one can navigate through the outline, and not having ::: ::: in the final document.
An example of such implementation in Julia is shown below.
"""
    remove_before_render(src::IO, out::IO; shift=true)

Remove the following from `qmd` files.
```default
:::
REMOVE BEFORE RENDER
:::
```

If `shift=false`, three empty lines replace the above three lines.
"""
function remove_before_render(src::IO, out::IO; shift=true)
    for line in eachline(src)
        if line == ":::"
            line2 = readline(src)
            if line2 == "REMOVE BEFORE RENDER"
                readline(src) # read and ignore 3rd line
                if !shift
                    println(out)
                    println(out)
                    println(out)
                end
                continue
            else
                println(out, line)
                println(out, line2)
                continue
            end
        end
      
        println(out, line)
    end
end
Notice that it is necessary to work on the file with ::: :::, and include the processed file in the _quarto.yml file. For example, work on figure.qml and name the processed file figure_proc.qml. Include figure_proc.qml in _quarto.ym for rendering.

title: Figure
text:
Configuration

Listing 1: Move figure caption to the top in _quarto.yml
format:
  html:
    fig-cap-location: top

text:
Create an anchor ANCHOR-1 with
[ANCHOR-1]{#anchor-1}

title: Cross reference
text:
Link
Create link to

anchor: Link to Anchor-1
URL https://www.google.com, or
URL Google,
email fake@example.com,
local file styles, or
local file file:styles.css,
section Anchor,
section in another qmd file, Figure basic,
figure in another qmd file, Go to Julia Logo.

* anchor: [Link to Anchor-1](#anchor-1)
* URL <https://www.google.com>{target="_blank"}, or
* URL [Google](https://www.google.com){target="_blank"},
* email <fake@example.com>,
* local file [styles](styles.css), or
* local file <file:styles.css>,
* section [Anchor](#anchor),
* section in another `qmd` file, [Figure basic](figure.qmd#figure-basic),
* figure in another `qmd` file, [Go to Julia Logo](figure.qmd#fig-julia_logo_local).
Open link in a new browser tab with {target="_blank"}.
[Quarto Web](https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-web/tree/main){target="_blank"}
Quarto Web

title: About
text: About this site

title: Code Block
Code Block
CSS
text:
Copy

style.css
theme.scss

from Quarto to project directory, and add the following to _quarto.yml.
format:
  html:
    theme:
      light: [cosmo, theme.scss]
    css: styles.css

title: CSS
text:
Copy

style.css
theme.scss

from Quarto to project directory, and add the following to _quarto.yml.
format:
  html:
    theme:
      light: [cosmo, theme.scss]
    css: styles.css

title: Table
text:
Size and position

Use CSS grid to adjust the width and position the table.
The tbl-colwidths option adds up to 12.

Use : to align each column.

:::{.grid}
:::{.g-col-2}
:::
:::{.g-col-8}
| Case | Well | Production | Formation | Year |
|:-----|:-----|-----------:|:---------:|-----:|
| JJ-1 | H-1  | 20         |  WFMPA    | 5    |
| JJ-1 | H-2  | 22         |  WFMPA    | 5    |
| JJ-1 | H-3  | 28         |  WFMPB    | 5    |
: Well production {#tbl-well_1 tbl-colwidths="[1,1,1,2,1]"}
:::
:::{.g-col-2}
:::
:::
